title: Elon Musk: 'I'll say what I want, and if the consequence of that is losing money, so be it'
description: Elon Musk said he doesn't care if his inflammatory tweets scare advertisers away from Twitter.

title: Elon Musk says the Fed will be too slow to lower interest rates again
description: Musk's opinion about the Federal Reserve's monetary policy gives a look into what a major company leader is seeing in the broader economy.

title: Tesla 2023 shareholder meeting: Musk says Tesla will deliver production Cybertrucks this year
description: Tesla held its 2023 annual shareholder meeting in Austin, Texas on Tuesday.

title: Google zeroed in on these 3 categories of climate companies to boost
description: For its most recent accelerator program for climate  startups, Google picked 12 companies and they were related to A.I., EV infrastructure and data reporting.

title: Black Sea grain deal that reopened key Ukraine ports set to expire this week as Kremlin mulls a potential extension
description: The Black Sea Grain Initiative, which reopened critical Ukrainian ports during Russia's war, is set to expire on May 18.

title: Biden will cut international trip short as Washington scrambles to avoid debt default
description: The White House and Congress have about two weeks to raise or extend the debt ceiling before the U.S. risks its first-ever default.

title: Ex-Apple employee accused of stealing trade secrets is exec at Baidu self-driving car joint venture
description: Weibao Wang is a senior executive at Jidu, an electric vehicle joint venture between Baidu and Chinese car maker Geely.

title: Here's what happened during OpenAI CEO Sam Altman's first hearing on artificial intelligence
description: Several lawmakers brought up Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act, the law that has served as the tech industry's legal liability shield for decades.

title: Jamie Dimon says it's ‘unlikely’ that JPMorgan Chase will acquire another struggling bank
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon answered questions Tuesday during an annual shareholder meeting.

title: DOJ charges former Apple engineer with alleged theft of autonomous car tech for China
description: The software engineer fled to China the same day his home was searched, and allegedly stole or attempted to steal Apple's "entire" autonomous source code.

title: Two online trading apps yanked from stores on Chinese mainland as regulators bring pressure
description: U.S.-traded shares of Futu Holdings and Up Fintech Holdings fell after they said they'll remove their apps from online stores on the Chinese mainland.

title: OpenAI CEO woos lawmakers at dinner ahead of first testimony before Congress
description: Lawmakers had a dinner discussion with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman. It comes at a peak moment for AI, which has thoroughly captured Congress' fascination.

title: Oil price dip ignores burgeoning Chinese demand and imminent supply crunch, IEA warns
description: The OPEC+ producers' alliance is set to next meet to determine its output policy in early June.

title: Western Union rival Zepz lays off 26% of employees as fintech cuts continue
description: Fintech group Zepz, which owns money transfer brands WorldRemit and Sendwave, is laying off 420 employees, the company told CNBC exclusively.

title: Samsung is exploring an 'offline' digital currency that works with Galaxy phones
description: Samsung said it has signed a memorandum of understanding with South Korea's central bank to conduct technical research on a central bank digital currency.

title: Here's where Biden and McCarthy stand on debt ceiling talks heading into today's meeting
description: The discussions have high stakes. Defaulting on sovereign debt would wreak havoc on the economy and roil markets around the world.

title: Vodafone shares drop 4% after record 11,000 jobs cut as CEO says telco 'must change'
description: Vodafone said it would cut 11,000 jobs over three years, out of a total headcount of just over 100,000.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Markets are playing a waiting game
description: Washington’s brinkmanship over the country’s debt ceiling continues for another day.

title: As the wind power industry looks to super-sized turbines, disruptors are betting on radical designs
description: New designs and ideas are providing a glimpse into how wind energy could develop in the future.

title: China's security crackdown could signal new realities for foreign investors
description: Foreign investors are left wondering if Beijing's crackdown on due diligence firms is another way China is limiting foreign access to investment information.

title: China's retail sales jump 18% as data continues to portray uneven recovery
description: China's activity data for April continued to show an uneven path for recovery as the economy continues to emerge from the impact of its stringent Covid restrictions.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Investors are playing a waiting game
description: Washington’s brinkmanship over the country’s debt ceiling continues for another day.
